text: Just saw a LinkedIn Influencer with 'Organic Growth' written in the profile with 65K+ followers claiming that he can help you in growing your platform, copying the posts from other influencers.

Jobseekers, this oneтАЩs for you.
 Every application, every interview, every follow-upтАж the pressure is immense.
 And I know what you're thinking: Am I not good enough? 
 But let me tell you, this isnтАЩt about you or your skills. ItтАЩs about a broken system where 60% of applicants never hear back. 
 Your mental health is not worth sacrificing for a system that doesnтАЩt acknowledge your worth. 
 Please remember, taking care of yourself is the real priority. 
 Your dream job will come, but for now, breathe. ЁЯМ╗
Looking for jobs on LinkedIn is like online dating: Full of promises, but in the end, youтАЩre just left ghosted.

LinkedIn scams be like: 'Congratulations, you've been selected for a role you didnтАЩt even apply for!' 
 The catch? Pay Rs. 50,000 for the honor.

sapne dekhna achi baat hai,
lekin job ka sapna dekh ke 'interested' likhna,
yeh toh achi baat nahi hai na?

Next time when I'll be reading some LinkedIn Influencer's story, I am starting from the last line.
If there's a link attached to it, it's most probably a fake one.
Saves me time!

Every time I poured my heart into 5-6 rounds of interviews and faced rejection, it felt like a punch in the gut. The sleepless nights, the endless preparation, all for nothing.

But looking back, I realize it wasnтАЩt nothing. It was the UniverseтАЩs way of saying, тАЬNot this one, something better is on the way.тАЭ

Every single time, IтАЩve been shown why that rejection happened.

Doors I thought I wanted to walk through were shut, only to have the right ones swing open.

The kind that aligned with my growth, my values, and my happiness.

At first, it stung. It hurt deeply. But now, when things donтАЩt go as planned, I donтАЩt panic.

I donтАЩt question my worth. I sit back, breathe, and trust. The Universe knows.

I know there's another plan waiting. Something bigger, better, and just for me.

To anyone feeling the weight of rejection: trust that the closed doors are protecting you from something you canтАЩt see right now.

Your path is being cleared for something even more beautiful.

To everyone who's still looking for a job...

I see you. I feel you. 💔

Every rejection email feels like a punch in the gut, and every 'We'll get back to you' sounds more like 'You'll never hear from us.'

But I want you to know, you're not alone in this. 🌸

According to a study, 80% of jobseekers struggle with anxiety and self-doubt during their search. It's normal to feel lost, but it's not the end.

Take breaks, breathe, and remember, this doesn't define you. Your worth is not tied to an offer letter. 💥

Your mental health matters more than any job.

Sometimes, we forget that a companyтАЩs brand name doesnтАЩt define someoneтАЩs talent. ItтАЩs easy to get caught up in the 'big company = big talent' mindset, but that's not always the case.

IтАЩve had the privilege of working with people from smaller companies (lesser known) who blow me away with their skills and dedication. They donтАЩt need a fancy title or a famous brand behind them to prove their worth.

I've seen the other side tooтАФpeople in top-tier companies feeling lost, overwhelmed, or stuck, even though the world sees them as 'successful'.

LetтАЩs stop attaching someoneтАЩs value to the company they work for. Freshers especially need to hear thisтАФskills are what matter, not the size of the company behind them.

At the end of the day, happiness and growth donтАЩt come from a brand name, they come from doing what you love and constantly improving your craft.

So when I left a toxic work environment, I told my manager a simple thing and felt so good 😯

I just said-

'Hope your son gets a manager like you.
I hope that the manager behaves the same way as you did with me.
Thank you.'

Now tell me 1 thing-

She always said that she was a great manager.
Why will she get offended?

I just told her that I wish her son would get a manager like she was.

If you felt bad, then that means you were a bad manager and now you know it. � 80

If you feel good, then take it as a blessing for your son and you'll really want someone to treat your son/daughter in the same way.

She cannot be even angry with me else it'll prove that she was not a 'great' manager.

Muskan - 1
Manager - 0

Muskan -> Aura +100000000

(Fictional message unfortunately :(
)

Hope you all become the people that your sons/daughters will like to work under 🙏

There are a lot of bad people/things, bring a small change and break the chain :)

I am an AI Tools & ChatGPT Expert, and my salary package is 42 LPA.

Sounds familiar? If youтАЩve been on YouTube recently, IтАЩm sure youтАЩve seen this ad at least 100 times. Now, I have just one simple question тАУ Can someone please tell me which companies are hiring for this role and paying 42 LPA? Because IтАЩm also considering a career switch! ЁЯШВ

See guys, learning how to use a few AI tools won't magically get you a 42 LPA job. Selling courses isnтАЩt wrong, but selling them by giving false hopes is. Just because someone tells you that learning how to use a few AI tools will instantly land you a high-paying job doesnтАЩt make it true.

So, a humble request тАУ donтАЩt fall for these unrealistic promises. Invest in courses only to upskill yourself, not with the expectation of overnight success.
If anyone actually finds this 42 LPA AI Tools & ChatGPT Expert job, please let me know. IтАЩll also update my resume! ЁЯдг

People talk about writing on LinkedIn like itтАЩs a formula.

Write about this + this.

And your posts will do well.

But what does 'well' even mean?

Lots of likes?
Lots of reach?
Lots of people seeing your post?

They donтАЩt talk about the type of people liking it.
The kind of reach youтАЩre getting.
The exact people seeing your post.

ThereтАЩs a lot you can't control.
But there are things you can.

Defining what 'well' means for yourself is one of them.

Because someone elseтАЩs 'well' is not your 'well.'

If youтАЩre blindly following, you donтАЩt have an algorithm issue.

You have a strategy issue.

Because your strategy informs what you do.

And just as importantly, what you donтАЩt do.

Your strategy will inform your positioning.

That in turn will shape your messaging.

And your messaging connects with....

WellтАж

Your customers.

Not just well. But really well.

---

Control the things you can and should.

3 things a vacation with my parents taught me.

(This was the first time when just the 3 of us had gone for a holiday.
It turned out to be an awesome experience - much better than I had thought.)

Upon my return, the next day as I was meditating, I reflected on the 4 days, asking myself if there was anything new I figured about myself or them.

Here they are:

1. No amount of material success, social validation, professional growth or bank balance can match up to the feeling of pampering your parents and making them feel proud of who you have become.

Their pride when people asked me for selfies, the comfort in which we travelled and stayed - everything made them act like kids in a toy store.

Nothing makes a child happier than to see their parents experience this joy.

2. The number of such occasions with your parents is drastically reducing.

We walked for 5-8kms every day and by the end of the day, both of them were quite tired. They are both 70+, so it's a matter of a few years until such holidays come to a stop.

I wish I had started long ago :(

3. Your parents have lived their life and are set in their ways.
What they need now is not change.
What they need is acceptance.

I do not agree with everything that my parents say or do, and for the longest time, I thought it is my duty to change their ways.

I was wrong.

At this age, the best I can do is to accept them.

There isn't much time.

Call them, visit them, spend time with them, travel with them.

They do not need your money.
They need your time.

PS: Every week, I share such thoughts in my newsletter. You can receive that email for free by subscribing from the link in comments.

If you don't understand the value of retention you can't survive the Service industry.

But, why do people promote retention of clients?

Because it's proof of the quality of services you are providing.

I retained 50% of my clients to date.

Whenever I ask them about their expectations,

They end up saying 'We don't have to worry about this, we know the quality you offer.'

How do you retain clients?

ONE Formula

- never compromise with the quality you offer

Clients return for the experience.

As we say Experience>>>>>>>>>>

By creating content that resonates, I help B2B and B2C retain their customers.

I landed my dream tech job in the USA during a recession... without sending a single application!

Yep, you read that right. And no, it wasn't just luck.

HereтАЩs how I made it happen:

I went all-in on making my LinkedIn profile stand out.

Every project I worked on? Posted it.

The impact it had? Documented it.

The problems it solved? Broke it all down.

Then I discovered my golden ticket - Kaggle competitions.

Instead of just participating, I started publishing in-depth notebooks breaking down complex ML problems into bite-sized pieces.

Each notebook told a story: the 'why' behind feature engineering, the reasoning for model selection, even the failed experiments.

I was solving real problems and teaching others along the way.

Before I knew it, people were actually engaging with my content, and guess who started sliding into my DMs? Hiring managers!
